# Info

This is the landing page of the club. On this website, you will be able to access distributed resources and slideshows used during club sessions.

If not done already, fill in [this](https://forms.gle/3xtChykNG3L4h34w8) form please.

<br>

# Download the base language R

* Download the base language of R, which your computer needs before installing other things, [here](https://cran.csiro.au/).

<br>

# Download RStudio

* Download RStudio, the interface to use the language R which we installed above, [here](https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download).

<br>

# Why you need both R and RStudio

![Analogy as to why we need both R and RStudio. Credit: ModernDive. ](https://d33wubrfki0l68.cloudfront.net/0b4d0569b2ddf6147da90b110fbb2a17653c8b08/f06f3/images/shutterstock/r_vs_rstudio_1.png)

<br> 

More precisely, R is the programming language the computer uses as instructions to run computations, while RStudio is an integrated development environment (IDE), an interface with a bunch of conveniences in features and tools (allowing us to better use the language for our data purposes).
